page.title: 01HOUSING IN DUNURE
page.content: Original village of terraced cottages lies adjacent to harbour, were built around 1800 but now modernised from original "but and ben" with loft.A few crofts still exist from 18th century. A few private houses were built from about 1900 and in 1930s Council house building commenced until 1970s.They are mainly two storey terraced and semi-detached houses of two to five apartments.A number of these have been purchased by tenants from Local Authority since 1979.Modern detached private houses, a 1960-80 development are mainly in area of Fisherton once a separate small community one mile from village near school,church and farm of same name.The streets are named appropriately Harbour View,Sea View, Garden Row,Castle Road,Arran View, Kennedy Drive,Carrick Place,Fisherton Avenue and Station Road.
